An error occurred. You might be offline: An error occurred. You might be offline or logged out.
Your site does not provide any templates: Your site does not provide any templates to support.
Limit AMP on a subset of the WordPress <: Limit AMP on a subset of the WordPress Template Hierarchy:
Are you sure you want to disable the sin: Are you sure you want to disable the singular template? This template is needed to serve individual posts and pages as AMP.
Note that disabling pages will prevent y: Note that disabling pages will prevent you from serving your homepage as AMP.
Note that disabling pages will prevent you from serving your posts page (blog index) as AMP.
Note that disabling pages will prevent you from serving your homepage and posts page (blog index) as AMP.
This page has unsaved changes. Are you s: This page has unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to leave?
When a plugin adds markup that is not al: When a plugin adds markup that is not allowed in AMP, you may let the AMP plugin remove it, or you may suppress the plugin from running on AMP pages. The following list includes all active plugins on your site, with any of those detected to be generating invalid AMP markup appearing first.
Now updated to version %1$s since suppre: Now updated to version %1$s since suppressed at %2$s.
In Reader mode, there are two versions o: In Reader mode, there are two versions of your site, and two different themes are used for the AMP and non-AMP versions. You have the option of using an existing AMP-compatible theme, or you can use the AMP Legacy theme (formerly known as the Classic theme).
In Standard Mode your site uses a single: In Standard Mode your site uses a single theme and there is a single version of your content. You can opt out from AMP selectively for parts of your site. Every canonical URL will be either AMP or non-AMP.
Your theme indicates it has special supp: Your theme indicates it has special support for the legacy templates in Reader mode.
Some supported themes cannot be installe: Some supported themes cannot be installed automatically on this site. To use, please install them manually or contact your hosting provider.
The following themes are not available b: The following themes are not available because your site (probably the active theme) has customised the AMP query var too late (it is set to %1$s as opposed to the default of %2$s). Please make sure that any customisations done by defining the %3$s constant or adding an %4$s filter are done before the %5$s action with priority 8.
Your active theme \u201c%s\u201d is not: Your active theme “%s” is not available as a reader theme. If you wish to use it, Transitional mode may be the best option for you.
Select the theme template for mobile vis: Select the theme template for mobile visitors
Please see AMP project's <a href=\"%1$s\: Please see AMP project's documentation for %2$s, as well as the plugin's analytics documentation. Each analytics configuration supplied below must take the form of a JSON object beginning with a %4$s and ending with a %5$s. Do not include any HTML tags like %6$s or %7$s. For the type field, supply one of the available analytics vendors, or leave it blank for in-house analytics. For Google Analytics specifically, the type should be %9$s.
Are you sure you want to delete this ent: Are you sure you want to delete this entry?
Must be a valid vendor or left blank for: Must be a valid vendor or left blank for in-house analytics.
Provide site tracking ID here (e.g. UA-X: Provide site tracking ID here (eg UA-XXXXX-Y)
For Google Analytics please consider usi: For Google Analytics, please consider using Site Kit by Google. This plugin configures analytics for both non-AMP and AMP pages alike, avoiding the need to manually provide a separate AMP configuration here. Nevertheless, for documentation on manual configuration see Adding Analytics to your AMP pages.
You are using an old version of WordPres: You are using an old version of WordPress. Please upgrade to access all of the features of the AMP plugin.
The AMP configuration wizard helps you c: The AMP configuration wizard helps you choose the best configuration settings for your site.
Your active theme is known to work well: Your active theme is known to work well in standard and transitional mode.
Your active theme is known to work well in standard mode.
In Transitional mode the active theme's: In Transitional mode, the active theme's templates are used to generate both the AMP and non-AMP versions of your content, allowing for each canonical URL to have a corresponding (paired) AMP URL. This mode is useful to progressively transition towards a fully AMP-compatible site. Depending on your themes/plugins, a varying level of development work may be required.
A JSON object is required, e.g. {\u2026}: A JSON object is required, eg {…}
Your active theme is known to work well: Your active theme is known to work well in transitional mode.
